title: Kashmir dispute; a reminder of unfulfilled promises: Pak Consul Gen.
content:
ISLAMABAD, Oct 27 (APP): Pakistan Consul General in the United Arab Emirates Hussain Muhammad on Sunday said that Kashmir Black Day was being served as a reminder of the unresolved issue and unfulfilled promises made under relevant UN Security Council’s resolutions.
Addressing an event to observe Kashmir Black Day at the Consulate, Dubai and attended by members of the Kashmiri and Pakistani communities, he said that the people of Indian illegally occupied Kashmir (IIOJK) continued to face hardships for over seven decades.
Hussain said that Pakistan continued to extend moral, diplomatic, and political support to the just cause of Kashmir and urged all, especially youth, to play an active role in raising awareness about the Kashmir issue on all platforms.
“In today’s digital world, our youth must highlight the Kashmir issue on the international stage so that the world remains informed about the continued struggle of the Kashmiri people,” emphasised the consul general.
Messages from the President and Prime Minister of Pakistan on Kashmir Black Day reaffirming Pakistan’s commitment to support the Kashmiri cause were read out during the event, a press release said.
A special documentary video shedding light on the ongoing struggle and hardships faced by the people of IIOJK was also shown.
Acknowledging Pakistan’s continued support, representatives from the Kashmiri community spoke on the occasion.
They extended gratitude to the government and people of Pakistan for standing with their Kashmiri brothers and sisters in the struggle for self-determination.
